title: American Airlines passengers flee via slides as smoke engulfs plane
content: An American Airlines flight bound for Miami aborted takeoff at Denver International Airport due to a landing gear malfunction. Dramatic footage showed passengers evacuating via emergency slides as smoke and flames erupted from the aircraft's rear. The airline identified a tyre issue on the Boeing 737 MAX 8.

title: Tigress that killed 5 villagers in Pilibhit ‘gets life’ in Kanpur zoo
content: A three-and-a-half-year-old tigress, suspected of fatally attacking five individuals in Pilibhit, Uttar Pradesh, between May and July, has been relocated to the Kanpur zoo. After a week-long rescue operation, the tigress was captured and deemed healthy, but officials determined that releasing her back into the wild posed too great a risk due to her habit of venturing into populated areas.

title: 'England will have just enough': Experts agree hosts hold edge on final day in Manchester
content: Despite a resilient fightback from India captain Shubman Gill and veteran batter KL Rahul, former cricketers Michael Vaughan and Dinesh Karthik believe England hold the edge heading into the final day of the fourth Test against India. India ended Day 4 at 174/2, with rain expected to play a significant role.

title: 22-vehicle pile-up on Mumbai-Pune e-way kills 1
content: A tragic accident on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway resulted in the death of a 58-year-old woman and injuries to 18 others after a trailer truck's brakes failed, causing it to ram into 22 vehicles. The incident led to significant traffic delays, with emergency services responding to assist the injured, who were transported to nearby hospitals for treatment.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 billion worth of Amazon shares, holds stock valued at...
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: Shubman Gill breaks Kohli's massive SENA record, eyes more history in Manchester
content: India captain Shubman Gill's stellar form continued in England as he surpassed Virat Kohli's record for most runs by an Indian batter on a single SENA tour, amassing 697 runs in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. He also became the second-highest run-scoring Indian Test captain in a series, trailing only Sunil Gavaskar.

title: Model Ruchi Gujjar slaps ‘So Long Valley’ producer Karan Singh at movie premiere
content: Mumbai Police have registered an FIR against Karan Singh, the producer of 'So Long Valley,' for allegedly defrauding model Ruchi Gujjar of Rs 23 lakh. Gujjar claims Singh promised her a stake in a television movie project, including profit share and on-screen credit, but the project never materialized, and the money was not returned.

title: Nvidia CEO: Don't feel sad for my employees; I've created more billionaires than...
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: 'Why boycott WCL but play Pakistan in Asia Cup?': Ex-Pak cricketer questions India
content: Danish Kaneria has ignited controversy by questioning India's participation in the Asia Cup 2025, contrasting it with their earlier withdrawal from the World Championship of Legends against Pakistan due to national sentiment. He accuses India of inconsistency, suggesting that if playing Pakistan is acceptable now, the WCL should have been as well.

title: Longevity burnout: Bryan Johnson may shut down anti-aging startup; says, 'the problem is now...'
content: Bryan Johnson, the millionaire behind Project Blueprint, is considering shutting down or selling his anti-aging startup due to philosophical conflicts and difficulties in scaling his personalized protocols. He feels the business undermines his credibility in the philosophical space and distracts from his focus on 'Don't Die,' a belief system centered on radical life extension.

title: Tortured, locked up for 8 days: Dubai travel agent kidnapped in Bengaluru
content: A Dubai-based travel manager, Lawrence Melwin, was abducted in Bengaluru after being lured by a woman named Mahima. He was assaulted, robbed of ₹1 lakh and iPhones, and held for ransom, initially demanded at ₹50 lakh, later escalating to ₹2.5 crore. Melwin's cries for help led to his rescue and the arrest of four accomplices.

title: Happy National Parents' Day 2025: 75+ wishes, images, messages to share
content: National Parents' Day 2025, celebrated on July 27th, offers a chance to honor parents' unwavering love and support. It's a day to acknowledge their role in raising children and express gratitude through heartfelt messages and gestures. Whether near or far, simple acts like sharing memories, sending thoughtful notes, or even a quick call can make parents feel appreciated.

title: 'Hand was hanging by a thread': Indian-origin man attacked by teen gang in Melbourne
content: Saurabh Anand, an Indian-origin man, was brutally attacked by a teen machete gang in Melbourne, resulting in severe injuries. The attack occurred at Central Square Shopping Centre in Altona Meadows, leaving Anand with a severed hand, head injuries, and broken bones. Doctors managed to reattach his hand after extensive surgery, while several teenagers were arrested in connection with the assault.

title: 'Declare meats, fruits, vegetables': Travelers to US get weird reminder from CBP
content: U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) is reminding travelers to declare meats, fruits, vegetables, and other agricultural items upon entry to the United States. Recent incidents of non-compliance have led to penalties for travelers. A TikToker faced a potential fine for forgetting to declare a banana, highlighting the importance of adhering to CBP regulations to avoid confiscation and fines.

title: TN polls: EPS meets PM Modi in Trichy; first meet since alliance renewed
content: Edappadi K Palaniswami welcomed Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Trichy, sparking speculation about a potential AIADMK-BJP alliance despite past disagreements. This meeting, the first since their renewed ties, occurs amidst conflicting statements regarding a coalition government in the lead-up to the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, with EPS asserting AIADMK's independent victory.

title: Microphone blunder! Nasser Hussain roasts Dinesh Karthik on-air
content: Nasser Hussain playfully teased Dinesh Karthik for a microphone mishap during a tea break at the fourth Test. Karthik, now a commentator and batting coach for Royal Challengers Bengaluru, was reminded of the importance of his equipment. On the field, India recovered from an early collapse thanks to Shubman Gill and KL Rahul's strong partnership after England's imposing first-innings total.

title: Who is Gaza journalist Aoun and why did he put his camera, press shield on sale?
content: A Gaza-based photojournalist is resorting to selling his equipment to feed his family amidst a looming famine. ​ "I am the photojournalistMohammed Abu Aoun from Gaza, I want to offer my equipment and the press shield for sale so that I can buy food for me and my family," his LinkedIn post read.

title: First time in 55 years! Gill, Rahul script history for India in Test cricket
content: Shubman Gill and KL Rahul etched their names in history, becoming the first Indian pair in 55 years to surpass 500 runs each in an away Test series, emulating Sunil Gavaskar and Dilip Sardesai's 1970-71 feat. Their resilient partnership against England at Old Trafford offered India hope after an early collapse.

title: Cambodia-Thailand conflict: Heavy shelling continues; both signal openness to talks
content: A fierce border conflict between Cambodia and Thailand has escalated, resulting in significant casualties and displacement. International concern has grown, prompting intervention from US President Donald Trump, who urged both nations to agree to a ceasefire. The clashes, fueled by territorial disputes and political tensions, have led to widespread calls for peace and bilateral dialogue to resolve the conflict.

title: Government tells Air India to 'end backseat driving' in key departments
content: Following safety concerns and a recent incident, the aviation ministry has urged Air India to eliminate "backseat driving" in critical departments. The ministry emphasized that designated post-holders must have the final decision-making authority, ensuring accountability and preventing them from becoming scapegoats. The government is committed to supporting Air India in overcoming its challenges and achieving its potential, drawing on the expertise of Singapore Airlines.

title: Travis Kelce posts Taylor Swift photo dump: 13‑pic carousel sparks buzz
content: Travis Kelce's recent Instagram post, featuring cozy moments with Taylor Swift, signals a deepening relationship. The NFL star shared 13 photos, marking the first time he's publicly displayed their romance on his personal account. Insiders confirm the move was intentional, showcasing how serious things have become as they navigate fame and love.

title: Asia Cup: How India and Pakistan could clash three times in UAE showdown
content: The Asia Cup 2025 schedule has been released, with the UAE hosting the T20 tournament from September 9-28. India and Pakistan are in Group A, setting up a highly anticipated clash on September 14. Given their strength, they are expected to qualify for the Super 4s and potentially the final, leading to a possible three encounters between the rivals.

title: 'Messi Cam' Returns: MLS, TikTok to stream exclusive player-focused broadcasts again
content: Lionel Messi will once again be the focus of MLS's innovative 'Messi Cam,' a dedicated livestream tracking his every move during Inter Miami's Leagues Cup match against Necaxa on August 2. Available on TikTok in a mobile-friendly format, this 'Player Spotlight' initiative, in collaboration with TikTok and Apple TV, aims to elevate fan engagement.

title: Future-ready: Army to add more muscle on Pak, China fronts; new brigades to give extra punch
content: To counter collusive threats from China and Pakistan, the Indian Army is enhancing its offensive capabilities by establishing 'Rudra' all-arms brigades and 'Bhairav' light commando battalions. These units will be equipped with advanced weaponry, drones, and surveillance systems. The Army is also integrating drone platoons into infantry battalions and bolstering artillery firepower with 'Divyastra' batteries, aiming to transform into a future-ready force.

title: 'If you don't play bilateral, don't play tournaments either': Azhar on India vs Pak clash
content: Mohammad Azharuddin has weighed in on the India-Pakistan cricket rivalry, questioning the selective nature of their encounters. He suggests that if bilateral series remain off the table, the teams should also abstain from competing in international events.

title: India signs up for 3-day UN meet for peaceful Palestine; US-France lock horns
content: India is set to participate in the UN high-level conference addressing the Palestine question and the two-state solution, co-chaired by France and Saudi Arabia. Despite US warnings against participation, India hopes the conference will pave the way for concrete steps towards a two-state solution, advocating for an immediate ceasefire and hostage release.

title: 'Saiyaara' BO collection: Mohit Suri directorial crosses Rs 217 crore mark
content: Mohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara,' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has swiftly entered the Rs 200 crore club, amassing Rs 217.25 crore in India within nine days. Surpassing expectations, the film's success, fueled by positive word-of-mouth and an increased screen count, now challenges the Rs 300 crore milestone, potentially becoming one of Bollywood's most profitable ventures.

title: Even the dead are filling up Bihar SIR forms, Supreme Court told
content: Petitioners have accused the Election Commission of India of conducting Bihar's electoral roll revision in a fraudulent manner. Allegations include BLOs forging signatures, submitting forms for deceased individuals, and voters being enrolled without their knowledge or consent. Concerns are raised about transparency, accountability, and potential disenfranchisement, especially with the demand for citizenship proof for voter enrollment.

title: India-UK trade pact to benefit youth, MSMEs, startups: PM Modi
content: PM Modi launched infrastructure projects worth over Rs 4,800 crore in southern TN, including a new airport terminal. He highlighted the India-UK FTA's benefits for TN's youth, MSMEs, and traditional industries, emphasizing tax-free access to the UK market for 99% of Indian products. Modi also underscored the NDA government's focus on TN's development through infrastructure, energy, and coastal economy initiatives.

title: Supriya claims 14k men got Ladki Bahin scheme benefits, demands CBI probe
content: Supriya Sule alleged that approximately 14,000 men improperly benefited from the Mukhyamantri Mazhi Ladki Bahin scheme, demanding a CBI investigation into the enrollment process. Ajit Pawar responded that funds would be recovered from ineligible male beneficiaries, with strict action taken if necessary. Aditi Tatkare stated that benefits for 26.34 lakh ineligible beneficiaries, including men, have been temporarily suspended pending review.

title: Is diabetes one of the first symptoms of pancreatic cancer?
content: Sudden diabetes in adults could signal pancreatic cancer. Research indicates a link between new diabetes and this cancer. Studies reveal that about one in four pancreatic cancer patients had diabetes diagnosed recently. For those over 50, sudden diabetes might warrant further investigation. Other symptoms include weight loss and fatigue. Early detection through doctor consultation is crucial for survival.

title: Taylor & Kelce surprise fans: Missouri baby name reveal goes viral
content: In a heartwarming tribute to Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, a newborn girl has been named Kelce Taylor at Liberty Hospital in Missouri. Born on July 25, 2025, the baby was welcomed as "the youngest Swiftie," adorned in a Kelce jersey. This unique name reflects the couple's significant impact on their fans, blending the worlds of pop music and football.

title: Air India pays interim relief of Rs 25 lakh to 166 crash victims' kin
content: Air India has disbursed interim compensation of Rs 25 lakh each to the families of 147 deceased passengers from AI 171 and 19 who died at the accident site. Verification is complete for 52 more families, with payments progressing. The Tata Group's AI-171 Memorial and Welfare Trust pledges Rs 1 crore ex gratia for each deceased and support for B J Medical College Hostel infrastructure.

title: Drone scare triggers chaos: 1 dead, 8 assaulted in mob attacks
content: Widespread panic fueled by drone sighting rumors and suspicious activity has gripped towns in Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh, leading to tragic consequences. A 25-year-old laborer died in Udham Singh Nagar after being hit by a car amid the chaos. In Amroha, two separate mob attacks left eight injured, with villagers mistaking victims for thieves.

title: 'The day everything changed': Patrick Mahomes reveals mom’s pivotal role
content: Patrick Mahomes' extraordinary football journey began in his Texas backyard, not on the field. His mother, Randi Mahomes, playfully tossed footballs in unconventional ways while managing her own tasks. These backyard games unintentionally honed Patrick's adaptability and creativity, shaping the unpredictable playing style that defines him as a Kansas City Chiefs superstar today.

title: Bihar elections 2025: EC to enrol 1st time, new voters in Aug
content: The Election Commission is digitizing records to remove approximately 6.4 million potentially ineligible voters in Bihar, while simultaneously preparing to enroll new electors. A special drive in August will focus on fresh enrollments, requiring applicants to provide proof of Indian citizenship, date and place of birth, and parental details where necessary.

title: Ja Morant’s viral China dunk: Sparks debate over NBA Dunk Contest snub
content: Ja Morant's dunk in China is creating a buzz. The Memphis Grizzlies star performed a reverse dunk during his Nike tour. The video went viral, sparking calls for him to join the NBA Slam Dunk Contest. Fans believe his participation could revive the event. Morant has hinted at joining if other stars participate.

title: Schoolgoers to learn about Operation Sindoor in new NCERT module
content: NCERT is developing an educational module on ‘Operation Sindoor’ to educate schoolchildren about India's military capabilities and technological advancements. The module, designed for Classes 3 to 12, will highlight India's defence readiness, scientific progress, and growing global stature. It will also cover themes like Mission LiFE, the Partition's horrors, and India's space achievements, including Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's ISS visit.

title: Odisha girl ‘set ablaze’ retracts earlier statement
content: A 15-year-old girl from Puri has withdrawn her claim of being set ablaze by three men. She stated the initial report was due to trauma. Police are investigating a possible self-immolation attempt. Authorities found no evidence to support her original statement. Four people testified in court regarding the case.

title: 2nd conversion case in U’khand: Six named; ‘link with Muslim Brotherhood’ suspected
content: Dehradun Police filed a second case involving six individuals for allegedly converting a 28-year-old woman and attempting to send her to the UAE with forged documents for marriage. SSP Ajai Singh revealed links to the banned Muslim Brotherhood. The woman, Sumaiyya, was influenced through online interactions, including a Pakistani cleric and a Dubai-based contact.

title: Sad to support a government that has failed to control crime: Chirag Paswan
content: LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan has strongly criticized the Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government over the state's deteriorating law and order situation. Paswan expressed concern about rising crime rates, including incidents of murder, rape, and robbery, questioning the administration's ability to maintain control. While acknowledging Kumar's past achievements, Paswan insisted that silence is not an option.

title: Shah: India's rising stature to invite new security challenges
content: Amit Shah highlighted the Modi government's commitment to zero-tolerance against terrorism through Operation Sindoor at the National Security Strategies Conference. He urged security agencies to enhance real-time data sharing and coordination to address emerging security challenges as India's economy grows. Shah emphasized a 'security-first' approach and the use of national databases for effective strategy implementation.

title: News in Frames | Women’s Business
content: Ima Market in Manipur’s capital Imphal is entirely run by women and hosts 5,000-6,000 vendors, who sell a variety of products catering to needs of the local people as well as tourists; the market stands testimony to the empowerment of women in the State and the socio-economic role they play

title: PM Modi in Tamil Nadu LIVE: Security tightened ahead of PM’s Gangaikonda Cholapuram visit
content: PM Modi to participate in the valediction of the Aadi Thiruvathirai festival marking the birth anniversary of Rajendra Chola I and Music composer Ilaiyaraaja to perform a 20-minute concert

title: NCERT developing special module on Operation Sindoor for classes 3 to 12: Sources
content: The module will have two parts — first for students from class 3 to 8 and another one for students from class 9 to 12.

title: Floods hit Aralam region in Kerala; shutters of Pazhassi dam raised as precaution
content: More than 50 houses were inundated, prompting the emergency relocation of people from the 13th and 11th blocks of the tribal rehabilitation area to the nearby Anganwadis and others to their relatives houses

title: Kidney for sale
content: The unearthing of a kidney-selling racket yet another time in Tamil Nadu last week has decimated the complacency that the State had tamed organ commerce through rigorous implementation of law and enhancing the cadaver donor programme. Serena Josephine M. and M. Sabari dive deep into the present circumstances to understand what needs to change

title: India has ‘greater responsibility’ to support the PKK-Turkey peace process: Pro-Kurdish leader
content: The Co-Chair of the People’s Equality and Democracy Party said that “commercial and cultural exchanges” throughout history have created a continuity between the “Kurdish geography and India” and calls for India’s support

title: Aides of Siddaramaiah, D.K. Shivakumar clash at Delhi’s Karnataka Bhavan
content: The incident involves C. Mohan Kumar, Assistant Resident Commissioner of Karnataka Bhavan, as well as CM Siddaramaiah’s special duty officer (SDO) and H. Anjaneya, SDO to Deputy CM Shivakumar

title: Three missing as boat carrying eight fishermen capsizes in sea in Maharashtra
content: An official said due to heavy rains and rough weather, the boat toppled and started sinking, prompting the fishermen to jump into the water and start swimming to save themselves

title: What makes the NASA-ISRO NISAR satellite so special? | Explained
content: The three-tonne machine has been a decade in the making and costs more than $1.5 billion, making it one of the most expensive earth-observing satellites to date

title: Mahajan Commission report on Karnataka-Maharashtra border row is final, asserts H.K. Patil
content: Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister H.K. Patil has said that there was no reason for Kannadigas to be concerned over cases pertaining to the Karnataka-Maharashtra border row before the Supreme Court, as it was a constitutional issue and no decision yet had been taken on taking up the case for hearing

title: Infosys co-founder Shibulal and wife Kumari to build a new cultural centre in south Bengaluru
content: A 20,000 sq.ft art and culture centre is being built by the couple at JP Nagar and it will be operational in about 18 months

title: What does the new U.K.-India trade deal entail? | Explained
content: What are the contours and implications of the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement? How will opening up the service sector to the U.K. help India? What is the Double Contribution Convention? When will the trade deal come into effect?

title: Rain fury: 21 houses partially damaged in East Godavari; all tourist spots in ASR district closed
content: No entry to Papikonda National Park and Gudisa grassland till further orders; 4.36 lakh cusecs of flood water being released at Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage

title: KTR once proposed merger of BRS with BJP, alleges Anakapalli MP C.M. Ramesh
content: In return, the Telangana leader sought that no cases are registered or investigation made into the scams committed by the BRS government, he alleges

title: New frog from Meghalaya named after Khasi rice dish
content: The Khasi word for ‘frog’ is the name of a second new species, belonging to the genus Raorchestes, recorded by the same team

title: West Bengal demands to see bank statements of aided colleges; institutions see move as blow to autonomy
content: The Finance Department has introduced Fund Information System (FIS) portal from financial year 2025-26 and it is mandatory to provide bank account details and FD details to get any financial assistance

title: West Bengal police launches helpline for migrant workers facing harassment in other States
content: The West Bengal police in the social media post said that the helpline number is 9147727666 which will be available only on WhatsApp and the people can send a message there with the necessary information, including your name and address.

title: Assam’s Foreigners’ Tribunals disregard constitutional safeguards: report
content: Given the possibility of a nationwide exercise to update the National Register of Citizens, the report calls for an urgent, fundamental rethinking of the legal structures governing citizenship in India

title: Opposition up in arms over alleged discrepancies in draft electoral rolls
content: UDF, BJP allege the ‘anomaly’ is part of a concerted effort in connivance with officials to set the ground in favour of CPI(M)

title: Ajit Pawar visit to Pune reignites Opposition charge of ‘flight’ of industries
content:
Congress accuses Mahayuti govt. of presiding over IT companies moving base to other States and cities
after viral video of Deputy CM’s outburst over civic issues during visit to Hinjewadi infotech park

title: Congress targets government over ‘organic cotton scam’, demands probe
content: Congress leader Digvijay Singh alleged that there has been a ₹2.1 lakh crore scam involving ‘fake’ organic cotton and some traders have made six-fold profits; he demanded an investigation into the matter

title: Tamil Nadu’s Gangaikonda Cholapuram decked up to welcome PM Modi; police tighten security ahead of visit
content: PM Modi to participate in the valediction of the Aadi Thiruvathirai festival marking the birth anniversary of Rajendra Chola I and Music composer Ilaiyaraaja to perform a 20-minute concert

title: Panchayat secretary of Inmulnarva village in ACB net
content: The bribe was demanded in return for setting aside a notice issued in connection with a construction carried out by the complainant.

title: India’s rising stature would lead to national security challenges in years to come: Home Minister Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah was speaking at the conclusion of the two-day 8th National Security Strategies (NSS) Conference-2025 organised by the Intelligence Bureau (IB), which was attended by 800 police and intelligence officers

title: Revanth calls for revival of ideology-driven politics, recalls Jaipal Reddy’s contribution to politics
content: Chief Minister recalled the political and administrative reforms initiated by Jaipal Reddy during his tenure as Union Minister

title: Study recommends two half-dose combination of drugs in a single pill for good blood pressure control in Indians
content: All three combinations, in patients aged 30–79, delivered equivalent BP reductions and similar rates of BP control, researchers said; all combinations were equally safe and effective with high tolerability over six months, they wrote in the paper

title: Air India disburses interim compensation to families of Ahmedabad crash victims
content: Compensation paid to kin of 166 victims; process under way for remaining 52; airline sets up memorial trust

title: Vellappally Natesan slams Satheeshan
content: The SNDP Yogam general secretary calls the Opposition leader anti-Ezhava and says he is not capable of leading the UDF

title: BJP slams SP MLA for saying that only illiterate people go on Kanwar Yatra
content: The Samajwadi Party is once again attempting to stoke division in a desperate bid to stay politically relevant, alleged the BJP

title: Trinamool Congress MP refutes Haryana CM charge against Bengal CM on migrant workers
content: Trinamool Congress MP and chairperson of West Bengal Migrant Welfare Board Samirul Islam on Saturday says a witch-hunt is going on against migrants in the name of ‘Bangladeshis’

title: Tej Pratap Yadav to contest Bihar Assembly election as independent candidate from Mahua
content: Following a recent controversy involving a video of his relationship with a woman, RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav’s elder son was expelled from the party, and ousted from his family

title: PM Modi inaugurates projects worth ₹4,900 crore in Tamil Nadu
content: Prime Minister Modi launches multiple projects in Tamil Nadu, including new airport terminal, extended runway, and cargo berthing facility

title: Thiruvananthapuram DCC president Palode Ravi resigns after leaked phone call embarrasses party
content: The discussion about the possibility of the LDF returning to power again in 2026 and the BJP striking deeper, making electoral gains in the Assembly elections, puts the Congress on the defensive. The tape also had disparaging predictions about the Congress faring poorly in the local body polls later this year

title: Reports on officials, religion, protests land journalists in trouble; those in towns most impacted, finds study
content: A study said that a journalist’s experience of the justice system differed based on location and status. Journalists in major metropolises were arrested in 24% of the incidents, this increased to 58% for journalists in small cities and towns.

title: Defending need for SIR in the Supreme Court, Election Commission cites parties’ complaints about voter list errors
content: In its counter affidavit filed in the SC, the ECI cites complaints made by AAP, Congress, BJP, AIADMK, Shiv Sena; ECI says it began the SIR “to restore puiblic confidence in the integrity of the electoral roll”

title: Closely monitoring situation: India on Thailand-Cambodia clashes
content: The Indian mission in the Thai capital urged all Indian travellers to check updates from authorities in the country before visiting tourist attractions in troubled areas.

title: State Election Commission gets over 1 lakh applications for fresh enrolment on voters list in the first three days
content: State Election Commission Commission has given time till August 7 for the public to include their names, rectify errors or make changes in the entries

title: T.N. Forest Dept. restores unused stretch of intertidal barren land along Uppanar River in Cuddalore
content: Steps have been initiated to form a Village Mangrove Committee at Kudikadu to further strengthen local participation and protective mechanisms, says B. Iqbal, Forest Range Officer. This committee will involve local stakeholders in protection, maintenance, and awareness activities related to the mangrove ecosystem

title: Issue guidelines within three months for safe collection, transport of medical samples, Delhi HC tells Centre
content: Currently, India lacks specific regulations governing how medical samples, such as blood, urine, or swabs, are collected, stored, and transported to diagnostic laboratories, a regulatory gap that has led to serious concerns

title: Houses damaged as trees fall on them in heavy rain in Thrissur
content: District administration opens three relief camps, where 132 people from 33 families are currently housed. Authorities asked to take pre-emptive measures against landslides and manage dam openings with utmost caution

title: Rajasthan govt. announces ₹10 lakh each to kin of children killed in Jhalawar school building collapse
content: CM Bhajan Lal Sharma also announced an increase from 15% to 20% in the permissible allocation for these buildings in the Dang, Magra and Mewat regions.

title: For five tribal settlements in Munnar, proper road is a distant dream
content: Children in the settlements are sent to hostels at the age of five so that they can attend schools. Those in need of medical care are carried on stretchers to hospitals in Marayur. People say a motorable road on a 13-km stretch would solve the problem, but blame the Forest dept. for hampering the project.

title: With groundwater turning saline and taps running dry, clean drinking water is a luxury at Pazhayar
content: TWAD Board supplies water to the village once in 10 days; officials say illegal drawal of water from the pipeline to the village is a major challenge and they are looking into it

title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari to launch protest for ‘Bengali Hindu homeland’, targets ‘infiltrators’
content: BJP Leader of Opposition alleges large-scale infiltration and voter list manipulation in West Bengal; calls for revision of electoral roll

title: Building the perfect trade deadline for the Mets and Phillies
content: New York and Philadelphia are battling for NL East domination. Here's how each can win next week's trade deadline.

title: Zayas, 22, becomes youngest current world champ
content: On Saturday night in New York City, Xander Zayas, 22, became the youngest current world champion by capturing the vacant WBO junior middleweight title with a slick, dominant decision win over Jorge Garcia Perez at the Theater at Madison Square Garden.

title: Judge headed to IL, but 'it could've been worse'
content: New York right fielder Aaron Judge will go on the 10-day injured list with a flexor strain in his right elbow. But in a positive development for the Yankees and their superstar, a scan did not show damage in the two-time MVP's ulnar collateral ligament.

title: Miami coach: Don't agree with Messi ban 'at all'
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano suggested MLS wouldn't have suspended Lionel Messi for an away game.

title: Stewart hurts leg 3 minutes in, Liberty fall to L.A.
content: Liberty star Breanna Stewart left the team's 101-99 loss to the Sparks on Saturday night after 3 minutes with a lower leg injury.

title: Yankees continue to deal, get utilityman Rosario
content: The Yankees acquired utilityman Amed Rosario from the Nationals in exchange for two minor league prospects on Saturday.

title: Royals bulk up, land Grichuk from Diamondbacks
content: Eyeing a postseason run, the Kansas City Royals acquired outfielder Randal Grichuk in a Saturday night deal with the Diamondbacks, landing a veteran who was removed from Arizona manager Torey Lovullo's lineup in Pittsburgh after the deal was formalized.

title: Rams' Stafford (back) to miss practice next week
content: Los Angeles Rams veteran Matthew Stafford, 37, who is dealing with back soreness, will not return to practice next week as anticipated, coach Sean McVay said Saturday, adding that it's "the smart thing to do a week at a time" with his star quarterback.

title: 12-year-old debuts at world swim championships
content: The globe got its first look on Sunday at 12-year-old Chinese prodigy swimmer Yu Zidi, making her debut at the swimming world championships.

title: 🏈 Iconic alternate CFB uniforms of past 25 years
content: We handed out nominations to some of the best, worst and wildest alternate uniforms donned by college football teams over the past quarter century.

title: UFC Abu Dhabi takeaways: Why Whittaker's loss is good for the middleweight division
content: What does Reinier de Ridder's win mean for the middleweight division? Brett Okamoto provides takeaways.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: Commanders LB Von Miller pays tribute to Kobe Bryant and former teammates with new number
content: Miller's former numbers, 58 and 40, were unavailable, but he had a solid connection to his new number.

title: Euro 2025 final preview: England vs. Spain, tactics, players, prediction
content: England and Spain have done this before: The Euro 2025 final is a rerun of the final from the 2023 World Cup, so we're in familiar territory.

title: How Arsenal's new signing Viktor Gyökeres became Europe's top striker
content: Viktor Gyökeres was in England's second tier a few years ago but he was Europe's top goal scorer last season and is now a major addition for Arsenal.

title: Who are the best NFL draft prospects for next year? Debating the No. 1 player at 11 positions
content: Who is the top quarterback, edge rusher and corner in the 2026 NFL draft class? We debated every position's early lead.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: 'Pay Us What You Owe Us': Inside the WNBPA's statement-making All-Star Weekend
content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: How Inter Miami signed De Paul and fit him in MLS' strict roster rules
content: With MLS' roster rules severely limiting Inter Miami's spending, how have the Herons managed to sign another high-impact -- and high-earning -- friend of Lionel Messi's?

title: Ranking the 25 best soccer teams of the past 25 years: A non-English, non-Spanish team is No. 1
content: Let's pick the 25 best teams since 2000. How many Liverpool, Barcelona, Real Madrid and Bayern Munich squads make the list?

title: How No. 1 recruit Saniyah Hall fits at USC, more commitment fits
content: Breaking down the fits of every top class of 2026 commitment, beginning with No. 1 Saniyah Hall to USC.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Man United considering Kolo Muani in striker search
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: PLL Week 9 preview: Key stats, players for Archers' Homecoming
content: The PLL heads back to Salt Lake City on Friday and Saturday. Here's the full schedule, key stats, injury notes and more.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Mock draft: Five QBs go in first round of 10-team superflex
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: India-Pakistan Clash In Asia Cup Stirs Political Row Months After Pahalgam Attack
content: An upcoming India-Pakistan cricket face-off scheduled just months after border tension and a ghastly terror attack has stirred a political controversy in the country.

title: Born At 6 Pounds, Died At 4: Gaza Mother's Final Kiss To Her Starving Infant
content: A mother pressed a final kiss to what remained of her 5-month-old daughter and wept. Esraa Abu Halib's baby now weighed less than when she was born.

title: UP Minister's Big Warning To Power Officials, Akhilesh Yadav's "Wires" Quip
content: Top officials in the Uttar Pradesh electricity department are not receiving distress calls from the public during power supply disruptions, the power minister has said

title: Turkey Records All-Time High Temperature of 50.5 Degrees Celsius
content: Turkey's environment ministry said Saturday that meteorologists had registered a reading of 50.5C in the southeast of the country, a nationwide record.

title: Trump's Latest Meme Attack Depicts Obama in OJ Simpson And The White Ford Bronco Police Chase
content: US President Donald Trump has once again taken a jab at former President Barack Obama and this time, using one of the world's most infamous police chases.

title: "Hand Was Hanging By Thread": Indian-Origin Man Attacked In Australia
content: An Indian-origin man was brutally attacked with a machete by a group of teenagers while he was on his way home from a pharmacy in Australia's Melbourne last week.

title: Siddaramaiah Has Done More For Mysuru Than Iconic King Krishnaraja Wodeyar: Son
content: Even as talk of a leadership change in Karnataka is yet to completely die down, Congress Member of Legislative Council and Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's son Yathindra Siddaramaiah has given his father a huge endorsement.

title: Fire, Smoke On Runway Before Takeoff, Dramatic Footage Shows Evacuation
content: An American Airlines flight was forced to abort take-off at Denver airport on Saturday after a landing gear malfunction that led to fire and smoke.

title: Israel Resumes Airdrop Aid To Gaza Amid Backlash Over Deepening Hunger Crisis
content: Israel said on Saturday that it air dropped aid into the Gaza Strip and would open humanitarian corridors, as it faced growing international condemnation over the deepening hunger crisis in the Palestinian territory.

title: EPS Welcomes PM Modi In Trichy, Sends Key Demands Amid BJP-AIADMK Alliance Reset
content: The meeting came against the backdrop of a simmering war of words between the allies over the nature of a possible National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government in Tamil Nadu, should the coalition win in 2026.

title: "KTR Offered To Merge With Us If...": BJP MP's Big Claim
content: BJP MP CM Ramesh has alleged that BRS Working President KT Rama Rao (KTR) had offered to have an alliance or to merge the BRS with the BJP on the condition that ongoing ED and CBI probes against his sister, K Kavitha, would be halted.

title: Mass Stabbing At Michigan Walmart Leaves 11 Injured, Suspect In Custody
content: At least 11 people were stabbed at a Walmart in Traverse City on Saturday - with six in critical condition - in what the sheriff said appeared to be a random act. A suspect was in custody, authorities said.

title: Agra Conversion Gang Has Pak Links, Used Online Games To Target People: Top Cop
content: Investigation into the alleged religious conversion racket, in which 14 people have been arrested so far, has revealed that the gang behind the efforts was linked to individuals in Pakistan.

title: PM Modi Most Popular Democratic Leader With 75% Approval Rating: Survey
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has emerged as the world's most popular democratic leader with a 75% approval rating, according to a recent global survey conducted by US-based data analytics firm Morning Consult.

title: Focus On Drugs-Free India, Ensure Better Coordination: Amit Shah To Agencies
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah addressed the Eighth National Security Strategies Conference (NSSC) in New Delhi, marking the conclusion of the two-day meet on Kargil Vijay Diwas.

title: India Will Retaliate If Proposed Carbon Tax Harms Domestic Exports: Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Saturday said India will "react and retaliate" if the UK imposes a carbon tax in the future that harms domestic exports.

title: Jagan Reddy's Firm Searched By Probe Agency In Case Linked To Liquor Scam
content: A cement company owned by former Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy was searched by the crime investigation department (CID) in Hyderabad on Saturday.

title: PM Modi Inaugurates Projects Worth Rs 4,800 Crore In Tamil Nadu
content: Landing in Tamil Nadu's Thoothukudi on Saturday, returning from his overseas trip, Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated and laid the foundation for projects worth Rs 4,800 crore.

title: 4 Of Family Die By Suicide In Madhya Pradesh, Note Recovered: Cops
content: Four members of a family died by suicide in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district, police said on Saturday.

title: NASA To Lose About 20% Of Staff Amid Trump's Federal Workforce Cuts
content: The US space agency NASA will lose about 3,900 employees under Donald Trump's sweeping effort to trim the federal workforce -- at the same time as the president prioritizes plans for crewed missions to the Moon and Mars.

title: Clash of Clans Summer Jam offers players the chance to join Travis Hunter's team
content: Supercell has announced that it has partnered with Travis Hunter for the summer jam . the event is designed to help players get their villages back into shape . Hunter is a highly respected athlete, but also an active Clash of Clans player . it is set to last until Aug. 1 .
